name: Unstuffed Bell Peppers
author: Paul E Hamilton
summary: A classic family favorite deconstructed. My kids love stuffed green peppers, but don't like to eat the whole peppers, so I came up with this to make it more appealing to my picky eaters.
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Break ground beef into pieces and add to skillet; cook and stir until about half of the beef is browned, 3 to 5 minutes
Stir red bell pepper, orange bell pepper, and green bell pepper into the beef; continue to cook and stir until the beef is entirely browned, about 5 minutes more
Mix tomato sauce and brown sugar together in a bowl; pour over the beef mixture
Stir rice into the beef mixture and stir; transfer to a 9x13-inch baking dish
Sprinkle Cheddar cheese over the mixture
Bake in preheated oven until the cheese is bubbling, about 30 minutes
